definition: Liu Xiaobo (1955-2017), Beijing writer and human rights activist, organizer of petition Charter 2008 零八憲章|零八宪章[Ling2 ba1 Xian4 zhang1], Nobel Peace Prize laureate in 2010
(classical) a type of battle-ax/to kill/to slaughter
surname Liu
dawn/daybreak/to know/to let sb know/to make explicit

Zhang Zhixin (1930-1975) female revolutionary and martyr, who followed the true Marxist-Leninist line as a party member, and was arrested in 1969, murdered in 1975 after opposing the counterrevolutionary party-usurping conspiracies of Lin Biao and the Gang of Four, and only rehabilitated posthumously in 1979
Chien-Ming Wang (1980-), Taiwanese starting pitcher for the Washington Nationals in Major League Baseball
Li Peng (1928-), leading PRC politician, prime minister 1987-1998, reportedly leader of the conservative faction advocating the June 1989 Tiananmen clampdown
Yang Bin (1963-), Chinese-Dutch businessman
deputy director/assistant head

Zhang Dan (1985-), Chinese figure skater

Zeng Fanren, president of Shandong University from February 1998 until July 2000
